Detailed Description

Provides access to camera features.

This class provides an easy way to work with camera features. It provides access to the GenICam SFNC features as well as custom features the camera might support.

The Class has a set of methods to get information about and work with a feature (such as type, minimum and maximum values), find out if a feature is accessible (available/readable/writable) and to read or write features.

More information about the GenICam SFNC (standard feature naming convention) can be found at the EMVA Website.

More information about the features of your specific camera can be found in the documentation of your camera available at the member area of the Baumer Website.

◆ GetInterface()

virtual NeoString NeoAPI::Feature::GetInterface ( ) const
virtual

Get the GenICam data type of the Feature object.

GenICam features can have different interface (data) types. Depending on the interface type, different feature access methods are provided

IInteger - data type integer
IFloat - data type float
IBool - data type boolean
IString - data type string
IEnumeration - data type enumeration, can be a selector or an enumeration
ICommand - command features are executable features
ICategory - used to group features which belong together
Returns
The interface type of the Feature object
Exceptions
FeatureAccessExceptionThe calling object is not valid

◆ GetRepresentation()

virtual NeoString NeoAPI::Feature::GetRepresentation ( ) const
virtual

Get a value, which recommends the representation type of the Feature object in a GUI.

The presentation is only available for the interface types IFloat and IInteger.

Possible values are:

Linear - IFloat and IInteger
Logarithmic - IFloat and IInteger
PureNumber - IFloat and IInteger
Boolean - IInteger
HexNumber - IInteger
IPV4Address - IInteger
MACAddress - IInteger
Returns
The recommended representation of the Feature object in a GUI
Exceptions
FeatureAccessExceptionThe calling object is not valid

◆ GetUnit()

virtual NeoString NeoAPI::Feature::GetUnit ( ) const
virtual

Get the physical unit of the Feature object, only available for the types 'IFloat' and 'IInteger'.

Returns
The physical unit of the Feature object
Exceptions
FeatureAccessExceptionThe calling object is not valid

◆ IsAvailable()

virtual bool NeoAPI::Feature::IsAvailable ( ) const
virtual

Indicates whether the Feature object is available.

"Not available" or false is equivalent to the access mode 'NA'

Returns
True if the Feature object is available to work with it, otherwise false
Exceptions
FeatureAccessExceptionThe calling object is not valid

◆ IsDone()

virtual bool NeoAPI::Feature::IsDone ( ) const
virtual

Indicates whether the command of the Feature object is still executing.

Only valid for the interface type 'ICommand'. Must be supported by the camera. Currently no Baumer camera is supporting this

Returns
False if the command of the Feature object is still been executed, true if it finished executing
Exceptions
FeatureAccessExceptionThe calling object is not valid

◆ IsSelector()

virtual bool NeoAPI::Feature::IsSelector ( ) const
virtual

Indicates whether the Feature object is a selector.

A selector is a possibility to define feature dependencies. The current value of a selector Feature has an impact on the value of another Feature object. Valid for the interface types 'IInteger' and 'IEnumeration'

Returns
True if the Feature object is a selector, otherwise false
Exceptions
FeatureAccessExceptionThe calling object is not valid

◆ GetSelectedFeatureList()

virtual FeatureList& NeoAPI::Feature::GetSelectedFeatureList ( ) const
virtual

Get a list of features that depend on this selector Feature.

Valid for the interface types 'IInteger' and 'IEnumeration'

Returns
The list of all features that depend on this selector Feature
Exceptions
FeatureAccessExceptionThe calling object is not valid

◆ GetRegister()

virtual Feature& NeoAPI::Feature::GetRegister ( void *  buffer,
uint64_t  length 
)
virtual

Reads the memory pointed to by the Feature object and writes it into the provided buffer.

Only valid for the interface type 'IRegister'

Parameters
[in]bufferThe destination buffer into which the read data is copied
[in]lengthThe size of the destination buffer. The method GetRegisterLength provides the necessary size
Returns
The Feature object
